citation.article-title: Glaciibacter superstes gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Microbacteriaceae isolated from a permafrost ice wedge.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Glaciibacter (Gla.ci.i.bac′ter. L. n. glacies ice; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Glaciibacter a rod of the ice).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, irregular rods.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of B2γ type, containing 2,4-diaminobutyric acid as the diagnostic amino acid.
The muramic acid is of acetyl type.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-12 and MK-13 or MK-11 and MK-12.

The major fatty acids are 12-methyl tetradecanoic acid (anteiso-C15 : 0), 14-methyl hexadecanoic acid (anteiso-C17 : 0), 14-methyl pentadecanoic acid (iso-C16 : 0) and 13-methyl tetradecanoic acid (iso-C15 : 0).
The G+C content of the DNA is about 65 mol%.
The type species is Glaciibacter superstes.
